content:
Hello, my name is Marcel, pleasure to be here. I hope this isn't gauche but I'll jump right into describing a puzzling conundrum that I've encountered through playing the Set Theory Game. I'm in Family Union World Level 7 if that is relevant at all.

I'm trying to prove from the assumptions:

  1. x is an element of H
  2. H = A
    ∴ x is an element of A

This is almost so simple as to be trite but considering the game does not allow Eq.subst I don't know how to proceed using the available syntax.

I would greatly appreciate any insight!

-Marcel
Are you able to use the rw tactic at this point?
Marcel Faust has marked this topic as resolved.

I am able to use the tactic 'rewrite'. The game includes this description:

The rewrite tactic can also be used with equations. If t is a proof of an equation p = q, then rewrite [t] will replace p with q wherever it appears, and rewrite [← t] will replace q with p.

I am at a loss as to how to properly format the use of this tactic in the command line. I know how to use it generally. Assumption 2 is the proof of the equality... And I figured it out typing this responses now this morning. Thank you!
